Great choice! The Environment and Sustainability Institute (ESI) at the University of Exeter is a highly regarded research institute that focuses on interdisciplinary approaches to solving complex global challenges. If you are interested in getting involved with research at the ESI, there are a few steps you can take:

1. Explore the ESI website: The ESI website provides information about ongoing research projects at the institute. Take some time to read about the research interests of the faculty and researchers affiliated with the ESI, and identify areas that align with your own interests. 2. Reach out to faculty members: Once you have identified potential areas of interest, reach out to faculty members or researchers at the ESI who are working on those projects. You can find contact information for faculty members on the ESI website. 3. Attend seminars and events: The ESI regularly hosts seminars and events related to environmental sustainability research. Attending these events can give you a sense of the research being conducted at the institute, and may provide networking opportunities with faculty members and researchers. 4. Apply for research opportunities: The ESI occasionally offers research opportunities for undergraduate and graduate students. Check the ESI website and Exeter Career Zone for current openings. By taking these steps, you can start to build connections and identify opportunities for involvement with research projects at the ESI. Good luck!
